contextId.information: Here "peaceful" and "quiet" mean the same thing. Paul wants all believers to be able to live calm lives without trouble from the authorities. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

Both of these words mean basically the same thing. Paul is emphasizing that women should wear clothes that are appropriate and do not attract improper attention from men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

The words "struggle" and "work very hard" mean basically the same thing. Paul uses them together to emphasize the intensity with which they serve God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
These two words mean basically the same thing. Paul uses them together to emphasize how much these widows pray. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

The words "bias" and "favoritism" mean basically the same thing. Paul is emphasizing that Timothy must judge honestly and be fair to everyone. AT: "that you keep these rules without being partial or showing favor to anyone" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: you keep these commands without prejudice and that you do nothing out of favoritism
